intro: Pellionia curvitepala, commonly known as the curled-leaf pellionia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle and related plants. The plant is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves that are often curled or folded, giving it its common name. It produces clusters of tiny, white flowers that bloom in the spring. Pellionia curvitepala is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
